name: Tybee Island Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For not ever staying in an inn before, we became hooked. Absolutely loved everything about it!!!
reviews.title: Absolutely Loved It!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: When planning a short wedding, the biggest obstacle is finding someone who will work with you. Although our requirements weren't outrageous, they were short notice (imagine planning a small wedding in under two weeks), and the Innkeepers (Marcy and Jonathan) went out of their way to accommodate every one of our needs. The Inn itself was fabulous with plenty to look at and in a great location that's close to everything, but the service is what sets this place apart. The breakfast was awesome, and they're more than happy to cater to your dietary needs (they welcome the challenge). The rooms were all amazing (we rented almost all of them, and they were all beautiful), and everything was perfectly clean when we arrived, and the Innkeepers were more than happy to help us out in any way possible. In a time when service might not be the top priority of many businesses, the Tybee Island Inn shines as a gem. If you're looking for a Bed and Breakfast on Tybee Island, you'd be remiss not to consider the Tybee Island Inn.
reviews.title: Great experience made better with outstanding service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at the Tybee Island Inn. We were just there for a one day stop over, but wish we could have stayed longer. It's a delightful setting, the house & yard definitely have character, our room was lovely, and Marcy & Jonathan could not have been more gracious & accomodating. We felt quite at home, were able to relax from a long drive, explored the Island sights Marcy & Jonathan suggested, & also enjoyed a delicious breakfast. You will not be disappointed if you choose this B&B.
reviews.title: Terrific stay on our one day stopover.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was the first experience at a bed and breakfast and was simply amazing, my wife and i are pretty picky about where we stay (when we travel the islands it's always 4 star or better), this inn was absolutely 5 star, this was a spur of the moment trip we had never travelled to the southern states and wanted to see Savannah, Tybee Island was only about fifteen minutes from Savannah and glad we opted to stay here rather than a hotel, the inn is beautifully landscaped the rooms were spacious and very clean, and the smell of Marcy's breakfast would have us getting up before the alarm!!!! We really enjoyed having breakfast family style and being able to talk to the other guests,I would definitley recommend this inn to all family and friends....Thanks again Marcy and Jonathan......
reviews.title: Felt like your home away from home......a welcome embrace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the inn. The inn keepers were very hospitable and personable. We loved the beach being within walking distance and the accessibility to the island tourist attractions.
reviews.title: charming and relaxing - a very quaint and solace inn

reviews.text: Stayed at the Tybee Island Inn Thanksgiving 2009. John and Marcy who are the on site managers welcomed us warmly and were accomodating and available without being intrusive throughout our stay. The Inn is located across the street from a nursing home which is a little surprising at first, but hey, keeps the neighborhood quiet. More importantly, it is located a 3-5 minute walk from the beach, a 5-7 minute walk from the lighthouse, but is far enough removed from the main road to be peaceful without being inconvenient.
reviews.title: Shabby Chic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts were delicious (even with a power outage Thanksgiving morning) and the housekeeping error free. The Inn itself epitomizes shabby chic with the feel of a beach bungalow as opposed to an inn. Some of the room configurations are out of the ordinary, but everything was comfortable. The Inn could benefit from an updating of fixtures such as the shower curtain rods, towel holders, etc. Besides that, the Inn is excellent and we would not hesitate to stay there again.
reviews.title: Hospitality Plus

reviews.text: Savannah continues to grow in popularity and some of it's charm/quaintness is suffering at the hands of increased tourism. Tybee Island is an excellent alternative as a place to stay as it is removed from the crowds and chaos of Downtown Savannah yet close enough to be convenient (15-20 minute drive). Tybee has a charm and character of its own, and the Tybee Island Inn is an excellent choice for accomodation.
reviews.title: Lovely, homey and great place for some R&R

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Tybee Island Inn was superb. If you are looking for something different, come to this Inn. To greet you out front are old live oaks with hanging moss and beautiful, relaxing gardens. The hospitality and people that you meet will not be found at high rise hotels. All of the themed rooms are quaint, but updated with all of the conveniences of home. Breakfast is wonderful, family style.
reviews.title: Perfect location, beautiful place, gracious hosts, delicious breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved it! Visit Tybee Island Inn.... beautiful decor, very pretty grounds, and hospitality plus by the owners / managers. Will definitely go back for another visit. Inn is strategically located close to beach access, great restaurants, and the Tybee Light House. You can walk or bike everywhere. Park your car and leave it! I enjoyed waking up each morning to the smell of breakfast cooking and fresh brewed coffee. When I'd stop in to change clothes or take a quick nap - snacks were there aplenty! The other guests were delightful and the management of this inn is extraordinarily accomodating. I'll be back....!
reviews.title: Very homey and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice accommodations, friendly staff, delicious breakfast, but a lot of money for the room. Also, the location was across from a medical care facility, was a bit of a stroll from the beach, and required a drive to the restaurants. It was very cold out, but there was no fire going in the fireplace. This spot would probably be great in the summer, but for the off-season, the price was too high to make it enjoyable.
reviews.title: Very nice room but a bit too pricy
Wonderful Spot
reviews.text: We loved the Tybee Island Inn. The Flamigo Room was great for us and our two dogs. Outside of the room was a great little courtyard where our dogs could play and we could sit on a porch swing. The room is laid out a little funny but we thought it had character. Maybe it should be a little cheaper because of its odd layout but we would come back! Marcy and Johnathon were wonderful and the breakfast was delicous. They made us feel at home and we really do want to return. Everything was nice and clean and you really feel relaxed and comfortable there!

As you approach the grounds it is very inviting. The large front porch is a great place to sit or have breakfast on a warm day. By the front door there is an easel with the name of each guest. The lighthouse room where we stayed is large and comfortable. It has a electric fireplace and a private deck covered by the limbs of a large old oak tree. The house and grounds were nicely decorated for the holidays.
reviews.title: Tybee Island Bed and Breakfast, what a nice place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thank Jonathan and Marcy for their hospitality. They were friendly and went out of their way to be helpful, answering questions about the area and providing information about restaurants and places to see. They always had a nice snack available and cooked a wonderful breakfast each morning. We certainly enjoyed our stay!
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I traveled to Tybee Island for the New Years holiday with our dog. We stayed 3 nights and had an excellent experience at this B&B. The Innkeepers went above and beyond to provide a wonderful stay for us and our dog. They suggested a fabulous restaurant for new years eve dinner and even booked our reservation for us! We want to go back when the weather is warmer for sure.
reviews.title: Don't stay in the Flamingo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this was a perfect place to stay if you want to be in a tranquil setting...lots of shade, perfect porch, but not far at all from any and everything Tybee has to offer. If you want privacy you can have it in your room or on the porch. If you want to go to the beach just walk maybe 250 yards and you are there! Great places to eat! Breakfast at the Inn is also great! Owners are wonderful people...not a thing bad to say about this place at all!
reviews.title: Peaceful surroundings with the perfect hosts....

reviews.text: The Inn is so adorable, every room is decorated with a seaside theme, but not your run of the mill "I have seen this before" boring. Very creative, inviting and relaxing. Jonathan and Marcy could become part of my family as they, too, are adorable - and so accommodating and hospitable. I would lilke to adopt them. We walked to the beach in less than 5 minutes, the neighborhood where the Inn is located on Tybee is lovely, grand old homes mixed with newer lovely homes. A nice park nearby to walk in, and of course, the Lighthouse for the history buffs. The drive to Savannah is only 20 minutes which made staying at The Tybee Island Inn the best choice for anyone wanting a quiet and relaxing vacation with sightseeing and lots to do thrown in.
reviews.title: Old Florida charm with a creative flair.
Perfection-the island B&B we were hoping for!
reviews.text: The house and the grounds are so lovely and relaxing. Each room was colorfully decorated in themes that reflect Tybee Island culture. Marcy and Jonathan are very accommodating, and ensure everyone feels comfortable and welcome. Breakfasts were delicious, a warm communal affair, starting the day off beautifully. We were three generations of 4 women---great for couples, too! We will all come back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved this little inn. Jonathan and Marcy are lovely innkeepers. The breakfasts were just right - not too much, not too little, not too fancy. They had beach towels and chairs for us to take to the beach, and even hats to borrow if we needed one. Fabulous porches. Sitting in the front porch gazebo sipping coffee, smelling the confederate jasmine... this was heaven. My husband kept losing me because I was sitting on another porch. (lots to choose from!)
reviews.title: My husband drug me into the car kicking and screaming...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach really is just 5 minutes away. For the folks who complained it was much further than that - it was if you didn't follow directions and went the other way. Tybee Island is a sweet little beach town close enough to Savannah to see all the sights, but close enough to enjoy those porches first thing in the morning and in the evening.
reviews.title: Romantic Weekend turned into our Wedding Weekend!

description: Twenty minutes from Savannah, a several minute stroll from the beach and two blocks from the Tybee lighthouse, Tybee Island Inn captures the beach casual essence of Tybee with style. Sleep Your Seashore Fantasy in king and queen guest rooms inspired by the sea- Mermaid, Dolphin, Lighthouse, Sea Captain, Savannah Beach and Coast Bird with private baths, air conditioning and cable TV. Other amenities include private decks, gardens, gazebo and hot tub.
